data.title: Imperial Academy of Hue (Rise of Vietnam)
data.meta_description: The Imperial Academy of Hue (Chinese: 成均館, Vietnamese: Thành Quân quán), commonly known as The Academy, is a national research university in the Vietnamese capital of Hue. Founded in 1788 by Emperor Quang Trung as a replacement of the Imperial Academy in Hanoi (Quốc Tử giám) when the capital was...
data.text:
The Imperial Academy of Hue (Chinese: 成均館, Vietnamese: Thành Quân quán), commonly known as The Academy, is a national research university in the Vietnamese capital of Hue. Founded in 1788 by Emperor Quang Trung as a replacement of the Imperial Academy in Hanoi (Quốc Tử giám) when the capital was moved to Hue, the Academy is the oldest university in continuous operation in the Greater Vietnamese Empire and one of the most prestigious institutions of higher education in the world, ranking third in the QS 2021 World University Rankings.

The Academy has 20,000 undergraduate students and 10,000 graduate students across 6 divisions: Quang Trung Imperial College of Arts and Humanities, Nguyễn Sinh Cung School of Public Policy, Alexandre Yersin School of Public Health, Nguyễn Trường Tộ School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Đỗ Đình Thiện School of Business, Phan Bội Châu School of Foreign Service, and an overseas campus in Havana (Cuba). It has an acceptance rate of 1.5% for the Class of 2025, making it one of the most selective university in the world.
